## Quarto

Quarto enables you to weave together content and executable code into a finished document. To learn more about Quarto see <https://quarto.org>.

## Running Code

When you click the **Render** button a document will be generated that includes both content and the output of embedded code. You can embed code like this:

```{r}
#SEMANA 12

library(readr)
tiroides <- read_csv("tiroides.csv")
View(tiroides)
```

You can add options to executable code like this

```{r}
# Medidas de dispersión
varianza <- sapply(tiroides_num, var, na.rm = TRUE)
desviacion_estandar <- sapply(tiroides_num, sd, na.rm = TRUE)
rango <- sapply(tiroides_num, function(x) diff(range(x, na.rm = TRUE)))
rango_intercuartilico <- sapply(tiroides_num, IQR, na.rm = TRUE)
```

```{r}
# Medidas de posición (Cuartiles)
cuartiles <- sapply(tiroides_num, quantile, probs = c(0.25, 0.50, 0.75), na.rm = TRUE)
```

```{r}
# Visualizar las 6 primeras filas
head(tiroides)
```

```{r}
# Resumen general del dataset
summary(tiroides)
```
